content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a round-trip flight from Buenos Aires to Beijing, leaving on May 28, 2026, and returning on June 3, 2026, check out one of the options and tell me if the airline for my return flight is the same as my departure flight.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to start by changing the "Where from?" location from Toronto to Buenos Aires. The relevant textbox for the departure city is labeled [13].
Action: Type [13]; Buenos Aires
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure location is now set to Buenos Aires. Next, I need to enter "Beijing" as the destination city in the "Where to?" textbox, which is labeled [14]. 
Action: Type [14]; Beijing
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The destination has now been set to Beijing. Next, I need to set the departure date to May 28, 2026, using the "Departure" date picker, which is labeled [16].
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently showing September and October. I need to reach May 2026, so I should click the "Next" button multiple times to advance the calendar.
Action: Click [74]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing October and November, but I need to reach May 2026. I should keep clicking the "Next" button [75] to advance further in the calendar.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.37
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing November and December, but I still need to reach May 2026. I should continue clicking the "Next" button [75] to advance further.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.39
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows December and January 2026, but I need to reach May 2026. I should keep clicking the "Next" button [76] to continue advancing the calendar.
Action: Click [76]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.41
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays January and February 2026. I need to get to May 2026, so I should continue advancing the calendar by clicking the "Next" button [73].
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.43
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays February and March 2026. I still need to get to May 2026, so I need to keep advancing the calendar by clicking the "Next" button [73].
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays March and April 2026, but I need to select dates in May 2026. I still need to advance the calendar, so I should click the "Next" button [75].
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.47
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now displaying May 2026, which means I can select the departure date (May 28, 2026). I need to click on the corresponding date, which is labeled [70].
Action: Click [70]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure date (May 28, 2026) is now selected. Next, I need to select the return date, June 3, 2026. Looking at the calendar, June 3 is labeled [48].
Action: Click [48]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The return date (June 3, 2026) is now selected. I need to confirm the date selections and proceed to find available flights by clicking the "Done" button [79].
Action: Click [79]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure and return cities (Buenos Aires and Beijing) and dates are set, but the flight search has not been performed yet. I need to click the "Search" button [20] to view available round-trip flight options.
Action: Click [20]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar has reappeared, possibly because the date was reset. I need to re-select the correct departure (May 28, 2026) and return (June 3, 2026) dates to proceed. May 28 is labeled [73], and June 3 is labeled [49]. After selecting both, I need to confirm by clicking "Done" again.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The currently selected dates are incorrect (June 27 is selected for departure, not return). I must reselect the departure date as May 28 and the return date as June 3. I will click on May 28, corresponding to the correct departure date.
Action: Click [44]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The departure date is now set to May 29, but it should be May 28. I need to click on May 28 ([43]) to select the correct departure date, and then select June 3 ([49]) for the return. I will now select May 28 ([43]).
Action: Click [43]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.89

Thought: The correct departure date (May 28) is now selected. Now I need to select the return date, which is June 3, 2026, corresponding to [49]. This will complete the date range for the round-trip search.
Action: Click [49]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.92

Thought: Both the departure (May 28, 2026) and return (June 3, 2026) dates are now correctly selected. I need to confirm the date selections and proceed to flight results by clicking the "Done" button [81].
Action: Click [81]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.95

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[2]: <button> "Travel";	[3]: <button> "Explore";	[4]: <button> "Flights";	[5]: <button> "Hotels";	[6]: <button> "Vacation rentals";	[7]: <button> "Change appearance";	[9]: "Sign in";	[11]: <button> "1", "1 passenger";	[13]: <input> "Where from?";	[14]: <button> "Swap origin and destination.";	[15]: <input> "Where to?";	[16]: <input> "Departure";	[17]: <button> "";	[18]: <button> "";	[19]: <input> "Return";	[20]: <button> "";	[21]: <button> "";	[22]: <button> "Search";	[23]: <button> "Explore deals";

content:
Thought: The departure city (Buenos Aires), destination (Beijing), and dates (May 28 - June 3, 2026) are all set correctly. Now I need to trigger the search for flight options by clicking the "Search" button [22].
Action: Click [22]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.97
